channel.title: Using SCAR on Vista!
channel.description:
[ul][list][list][list]You have came to this thread obviously because SCAR is not working on your system. So, here is how to get it working.
Here are some steps to take into running SCAR on Vista:[list] [*]Right Click SCAR's icon shortcut. [*]Click on Properties. [*]Click the Compatibility tab. [*]Select the compatibility mode to Windows XP. [/list]
If that does not work, try this:[list] [*]Click on the START menu button. [*]Find and click on Control Panel. [*]Find and click on Programs. [*]Click on Use an older program with this version of Windows. [*]Follow the instructions directed by the Wizard. [/list]
And if that does not work, try this one (Originally posted by WhoCares357):[list] [*]Go to the Control Panel. (Make sure Control Panel Home is bolded on the left) [*]Click on User Accounts and Family Safety (top right). [*]Click on User Accounts (top). [*]Click on Turn User Account Control on or off (bottom). [*]Uncheck the box besides "User User Account Control..." [*]Click OK. [*]Restart the computer if required. [/list]
After doing these methods, you might get the Windows Security Alert, just press Continue and you'll be fine.
After doing those, Hopefully SCAR will work on your system.
Also if you have ZoneAlarm on your system as well it might block SCAR. Here is how to unblock it.[list] [*]Open ZoneAlarm via the Tray Icon. [*]Go to Program Control and select the Programs tab. [*]Find "scar.exe" and change it's trust level to Super. [*]Have a green tick in each of boxes so SCAR has any right to access the internet. [*]Close ZoneAlarm. [/list]
Enjoy ;)[/list][/list][/list][/ul]

item.title: Using SCAR on Vista!
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

[quote=“Freddy1990, post:4, topic:213631”]Here my alternative guide:

  1. Get “Microsoft Windows XP Professional Installation Disk”
  2. Boot your pc with the disk in it
  3. Select the vista partition and press format
  4. Select the ex-vista partition and press install
  5. Once XP is installed, install SCAR

You will now have installed SCAR on vista (+ you get the bonus of less bsods and such)[/quote]
Have you ever even tried Vista Freddy1990? I reckon (like most people) are just going on by some other persons opinions

Read full topic

item.title: Using SCAR on Vista!
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Here my alternative guide:

  1. Get “Microsoft Windows XP Professional Installation Disk”
  2. Boot your pc with the disk in it
  3. Select the vista partition and press format
  4. Select the ex-vista partition and press install
  5. Once XP is installed, install SCAR

You will now have installed SCAR on vista (+ you get the bonus of less bsods and such)

Read full topic

item.title: Using SCAR on Vista!
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

[ul][list][list][list]You have came to this thread obviously because SCAR is not working on your system. So, here is how to get it working.

Here are some steps to take into running SCAR on Vista:[list]
[]Right Click SCAR’s icon shortcut.
[]Click on Properties.
[]Click the Compatibility tab.
[]Select the compatibility mode to Windows XP.
[/list]

If that does not work, try this:[list]
[]Click on the START menu button.
[]Find and click on Control Panel.
[]Find and click on Programs.
[]Click on Use an older program with this version of Windows.
[*]Follow the instructions directed by the Wizard.
[/list]

And if that does not work, try this one (Originally posted by WhoCares357):[list]
[]Go to the Control Panel. (Make sure Control Panel Home is bolded on the left)
[]Click on User Accounts and Family Safety (top right).
[]Click on User Accounts (top).
[]Click on Turn User Account Control on or off (bottom).
[]Uncheck the box besides “User User Account Control…”
[]Click OK.
[*]Restart the computer if required.
[/list]

After doing these methods, you might get the Windows Security Alert, just press Continue and you’ll be fine.

After doing those, Hopefully SCAR will work on your system.

Also if you have ZoneAlarm on your system as well it might block SCAR. Here is how to unblock it.[list]
[]Open ZoneAlarm via the Tray Icon.
[]Go to Program Control and select the Programs tab.
[]Find “scar.exe” and change it’s trust level to Super.
[]Have a green tick in each of boxes so SCAR has any right to access the internet.
[*]Close ZoneAlarm.
[/list]

Enjoy ;)[/list][/list][/list][/ul]

Read full topic
